attributes.action: Suspend the MP's pay rise on 1st April 19 until they make progress with Brexit.
attributes.background: On April fools day the MP's are due to get a pay rise of £2089.  That will be 1011 days since the referendum and they have failed to make any progress.  No employer would reward failure with a pay rise so why should the tax payer?  The pay rise should be suspended until Parliament agrees a plan.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
